comments.body: @znicholls after looking at the source it seems we can make this package `noarch`. That means it will build faster and we don't have to rebuild it often. The trick is to constraint the python in the `host`/`run` requirements.
If there were a sensible place to document that trick, it could help others.

Ah ok. The fact that you can build noarch packages was clear. What wasn't obvious was that I could put a constraint on python in `host`/`run` sections, I thought I could only restrict package versions there. Having said that, I'm not sure if there's a way to make that more obvious in the docs. At some point people need to have a minimum amount of knowledge, which I don't have, or be given help by generous people like you, cheers :D

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +11,15 @@build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps --ignore-installed -vvv"
